intro: Claytonia calyptrata, commonly known as the "spring beauty," is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of fleshy, oval leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pink flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas. Its unique appearance and early blooming make it a notable wildflower in its native habitat.
